snippet: Once the Knicks’ owner, James L. Dolan, undermined the team president to acquire Carmelo Anthony last year, the team was doomed to confrontation and chaos.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Basketball column asserts that New York Knicks coach Mike D'Antonio's resignation is no more than a formality, a good man cutting his losses from a no-win situation; holds that D'Antoni's exit was inevitable after Donnie Walsh resigned as Knicks president in June 2011; notes that the team has been mired in an era of confrontation and chaos since owner James L Dolan exerted his full control in 2001.
lead_paragraph: Once the Knicks’ owner, James L. Dolan, undermined the team president to acquire Carmelo Anthony last year, the team was doomed to confrontation and chaos.

headline.seo: Harvey Araton — Without Walsh, D’Antoni’s Clock Was Ticking
